intro: Ectrosia leporina var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered wallaby's ear, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is a shrub that typically reaches a height of about 1 meter. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
